doc.after: Most Shimer alumni continue to graduate school; 50Â percent earn master's degrees, and 21Â percent earn doctorates.[95][118] Another ten percent attend law school and five percent go to business school.[97] As of 2008, Shimer had 5,615 living alumni.[119] Nearly 25Â percent of graduates are employed in education (elementary school through college), seven percent are attorneys and seven percent work in the computer-software industry. The remainder occupy all walks of life, from consulting to social services to non-profit organizations.[79]
